text.__SUMMARY__: Aspergillus xerophilus is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Aspergillus section. The species was first described in 1975. It has been reported to produce bisanthrons, dihydroauroglaucin, echinulins, erythroglaucin, isoechinulins, neoechinulins, physcion, sulochrin, and tetracyclic.
text.Further reading: Hubka, V.; Kolarik, M.; Kubatova, A.; Peterson, S. W. (8 February 2013). "Taxonomic revision of Eurotium and transfer of species to Aspergillus". Mycologia. 105 (4): 912–937. doi:10.3852/12-151. PMID 23396159.
